website_summaries.verdict: These multi-use latches are great for securing cabinets, drawers, appliances, and much more.
pros: Require dual-button operation to release the locks, making it tough for children to unlock cabinets and drawers
Come with a flexible strap that allows for latching around corners
Included adhesive removes easily without damaging surfaces
cons: Can be challenging to remove the locks

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to the strength of a two-year-old
customer_reviews.text: We were having a terrible time keeping our toddler out of the fridge. He would go in, open drawers, and then leave the door open. It was a perfect game for our little boy. Man, was he mad when he discovered we added one of these locks. It seems to be holding up well so far to the tantrums and angry pulling, as he rages against the machine...door.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't look pretty but it works and it saves my spices for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a solution for this circular cabinet for years. It doesn't look pretty but it works and it saves my spices for being dumped all over the kitchen and the cat !
customer_reviews.author: Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I bought them originally for the fridge after my 2 year old got in and smashed a chocolate pudding pie all over the floor and dumped 4 pints of kefir onto the living room carpet. But I used the 2nd one to "lock" the baby gate into the kitchen that he had figured out!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Kept the dog out, but he tried hard!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog likes to raid the trash now and then. We were sick of it. I put one of these on a few days ago. Today, I came home to the attached photos. He grabbed a sliver of trash bag that wasn't covered by the lid, dragged it out as much as he could, but he couldn't get the lid open. I call that a success, even if we had to pick up shredded black plastic from the floor after. :)
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Overgaard

customer_reviews.title: Great for toilets
customer_reviews.text: - Easy to install - Easy to latch and unlatch one-handed - Very strong and durable - Keeps little hands out of the toilet - Can be used on cabinets, too
customer_reviews.author: Jenee

customer_reviews.title: We are in a rental home and cannot drill holes so these were perfect. They are also not hard to remove and ...
customer_reviews.text: These are just what we needed in our son's room. We are in a rental home and cannot drill holes so these were perfect. They are also not hard to remove and did not cause damage as my husband had to reposition them a few times but our 14 mo is unable to pull them off.
customer_reviews.author: Kaila

customer_reviews.title: but I love it! Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My son hates it, but I love it! Works perfectly, and was super easy to install!
customer_reviews.author: Will Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Alzheimer's helpful product
customer_reviews.text: For those of you who have a loved one with all Alzheimer's or dementia this particular item has been a lifesaver. My mom has been in and out of our refrigerator and freezer getting into things she shouldn't be ( chocolate, cookies) and also placing items in the wrong spot which makes them go bad ( milk in the freezer, ice cream in the refrigerator, etc. ). These latches are a lifesaver! They are simple to install and supply just enough sturdy support that she cannot get in and out of the freezer or refrigerator. It's one less thing we have to worry about- it's a blessing! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Instantly childproof almost anything without drilling
customer_reviews.text: These work on appliances and toilets, but they also work on doors and cabinets. Our doors have egg knobs, and we could not find any knob covers that would work. This keeps the door latched without having to drill into the actual door and damage it. These are good for travel or if you are staying somewhere temporarily and you do not want to damage things by drilling. The only downside is that they are pricey for a pack of two.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Compared these with others...going back to this brand!
customer_reviews.text: I bought only 2 of these at first then tried some different kinds mostly because the others where less conspicuous. I am buying these again because I realize now that I like the how these work best. You can unlock either side which is a bigger deal than you might think,and the remaining part swivels down, where as the other kind stay in that one position which is a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Egrimler

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed to keep the 2 year old out of the fridge! I placed it on the side instead of rapping it around to the front. It nicely swings down and out of the way if you want to keep it unlocked. Having it under the handle will make it too hard to undo to open.
customer_reviews.author: PitLove

customer_reviews.title: good for flat surfaces, nothing else.
customer_reviews.text: wasted money. Stayed on the toilet for a month, then came off. When it was working it worked well, but It doesn't handle curved areas well. I tried to put it on the flattest part of my toilet bowl and it held for some time, but if any of the glue is exposed the rest of the glue will eventually fail. Not many people have flat toilets, most bowls curve. Just the way it is I guess.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: double edged sword
customer_reviews.text: we've had these on for 4 years or so...enough to get the kids thru the drawer phase. They work good and look good. Good luck getting them off without damaging what they are glued on. We have some high end full wood cabinets and wood furniture and they will peel the full finish and maybe some wood off them before coming off. I tried customer service and they were little help other than 'use some soapy water and a tool'. No go. I've worked with putty knives, flat blades, two types of adhesive removers. I managed to remove one after about 20 minutes by working and working it- there are still scrapes and damage to the wood.
customer_reviews.author: DR Kuhns

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. Works well looks nice
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical to spend his much on a child proof lock, after all they sell a pack of 100 locks for just a few buks. However this was totally worth the money and more! We bought it for our large freezer, our 3 year old got into habit of stealing all kind of goodies We didn’t want to use the standard locks as they require drilling. So we opted for this lock and are extremely pleased. The adhesive realy works well, we used one on stainless steel and one on wood. I hope the clips don’t get rubbed out from all the opening and closing. I will update my review as needed. As of now 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: laya k.

customer_reviews.title: Best adhesion lock
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I didn’t fully appreciate how well designed they were until I got something similar by Safety First at the store because I was desperate. These are so much better. Fit most anything you want to keep closed. We’ve had ours on the kitchen cupboard with the trash since our first born (now 4) started getting into things. Still sticks (even with the new 10 month old pulling on it to stand). So nice that it opens both sides and opening the lock is intuitive and easy (even for grandma with arthritis), but still confounds the kids (even our take-things-apart-to-see-how-they-work toddler). Great buy! Worth the money. I’m convinced these are the best of these locks available.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Why require purchase of 2 packages
customer_reviews.text: The product looks good and will keep the refrigator door closed on the RV. What I am not happy about is they make you purchase 2. packages. No, not two latches in one package, you have to buy two packages which is four latches. I think that’s a little ridiculous. Why can you not buy one package of two. And yes, I tried, but it would not let me order with a quantity of one.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Easiest baby proofing tool.
customer_reviews.text: We love these Munchin locks!!! We originally bought these to keep our baby out of the dishwasher. They easily turn and are not as annoying for the parent as most baby proofed items are. My only advice is to TAKE YOUR TIME installing them! You're supposed to be able to turn them when not in use. I installed it a little too quickly on our coffee bar so I can't turn it when it's open. It's definitely still useable, but I don't want to take it off. Overall, we love this product. It's so nice for things that are not as obvious to baby proof.
customer_reviews.author: sleak88

customer_reviews.title: PARENT WIN ACROSS THE BOARD !!️
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old is a magician she can get in any cupboard locks I put on..... BUT NOT THIS ONE!!! It was so easy to install, just clean the surface and apply. My toddler can’t pinch the sides to get it off so my medicine cabinet and junk drawer are now safe and so is she! It’s multifunctional and can be used on drawers, stoves, cabinets and more!! Cons: They are on the pricey side for only 2, I also dislike how bulky they are and the lack of color options but my children are safe If you found this helpful please let me know! I definitely recommend spending the extra money and using these! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Taja Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I bought these, so I figured I should probably write a review. These are lifesavers, keeping both our young children and our clever husky out of closets we don't want them exploring. The dog figured out how to open our bi-fold pantry doors--these did the trick to keep her out of them when we aren't home. The baby was getting into the linen closet and pulling everything off the shelves-- no more! We even use one on the wall behind the baby gate in the kitchen to hold it open when the kids are in bed. We love and swear by these! They are sturdy and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui

customer_reviews.title: Great for Rerigerators
customer_reviews.text: My one year old learned how to open the fridge. It took him a few weeks of trying but once he succeeded, it's an every day, or hour, occurrence. The problem, as you can imagine, is he's pulling everything out, rearranging, but most troubling is that he tried to climb in! So I ordered these latch straps. Literally 2 minutes after receiving them, problem solved. I worried the adhesive wouldn't be strong enough to hold with him pulling constantly but it had been amazing. He is pretty upset with me. First the cabinets, now the fridge. Im locking him out of all the fun stuff. Ha ha!
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyBHill01

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old gave me a look that said hold my beer and watch this.
customer_reviews.text: Just put these on the top of my refrigerator to keep the kids from getting into it. About 30 min later my 5 year old walks over and trys to get in and can't get in. Some my 2 year old look at me and gave me a face like "hold my beer and watch this" pulled on the door and broke one of them loose. So as long as you don't have kids that take this kind of stuff as a challenge then you should be fine. Yes the tape was holding strong, I cleaned the area first and also tugged on it my self. Seems like pretty good tape.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Freezer Saver
customer_reviews.text: With kids at our house all the time eventually someone will leave the freezer barely open. Which is exactly what drove me to buy this product. Especially after we threw out tons of meat, other frozen foods and not to mention cleaning up all the melted ice cream. These are easy to install at whatever height you desire. Which of course depends on the height of your children. Very easy to use and I alway know the freezer is closed securely if these straps are snapped on. Great product for anyone who has small children. Can be used on so many different things.
customer_reviews.author: Sisson205

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, just a little tricky to open
customer_reviews.text: These were a lifesaver in securing our oven door and refrigerator door. I will say that if you have weaker hands It can be tricky to squeeze the release buttons to get it open. But they held up well and served their purpose. they didn't budge even with my 6-year-old and 18-month-old pulling on the refrigerator and stove door almost constantly trying to get them open. Highly recommend to anyone with a curious little one. Also when it comes time to remove new adhesive is left on the appliance surface which I was a little worried about
customer_reviews.author: Car

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR OVENS
customer_reviews.text: Only after you open it and read the instructions does it mention that it’s not for ovens. So frustrating. That’s the only reason I bought it, and of course I could only buy four. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt stick to some surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I bought these locks for my plastic garbage cans because my 1 year old daughter cant stay out of the trash. Unfortunately the adhesive does not stick to the plastic at all. I cleaned the area like the instructions say and it is a flat surface but it isnt glossy smooth so I think thats why it wont stick. Good idea, just didnt work for what I had planned. Seems good otherwise, Im sure I will find some use for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These work really great!!!
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing. I use them on a trash can that slides out, full sizes fridge/freezer, and a mini fridge/freezer to keep our kids out. I've tried many similar items and this has become my favorite. I have one on our fridge that has been installed for 2+ years so they really hold up. Also, they are not to easy or hard to use which is the main thing I have found as the problem with baby proofing. If its too hard then its also hard for the adults. If its too easy then its awesome for the parents until you see your kids getting into everything after them money and effort of failed baby/toddler proofing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: It's like getting into Fort Knox
customer_reviews.text: I just had to have these. My 2 year old grandson is living with me and he was constantly opening the refrig and staring inside or taking things out that weren't for him like soda, and spilling it on the floor. I was at wits end when I read about locks for refrigerators. I used one on the frig and the other on the cabinet under the sink where cleaning products are kept. He's very smart but hasn't figured out how to unlock them I would definitely recommend them to any parent with young inquisitive children
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pet owners trying to keep them out of the cabinets or closets!
customer_reviews.text: I got this latch after giving up on lining my door with velcro. The cats always managed to open our cabinet doors. I installed a single one at the top of the cabinet door and no more issues, the cats tried but they quickly gave up after realizing it wouldn't open. I also like that they pivot so when one end is disconnected it swings out of the way. I was worried it was going to look like a large kids latch but it's not that big which is good because I didn't want to stick out like a sore thumbs, almost blends in with it's neutral colors.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Sanz

customer_reviews.title: Lock Down
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these when I came home to find my freezer door wide open and had to throw out a whole freezer worth of food. This thing locks things down. It is so simply to install, just still it on there. It is very easy to unlatch, just press the 2 buttons on the side. It is so simple to relatch, just snap it back on the base. The adhesive is very strong and will hold though temperature change and time. My 2 year old cannot force the fridge open and now politely asks me to get him something. I needed this product in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Elia

customer_reviews.title: Stays put!
customer_reviews.text: No children at home. Purchased because my fridge is a POS with a door that often refuses to seal no matter what adjustments are made. It can be closed, yet come back later and its hanging open. I thought about a hook and eye type closure but didn't know what drilling holes would do. Thank you "Munchkin". Even when the door is determined not to seal, engaging this product holds it firmly closed and there will be proper resistance when next opened. My hands are funky but I have no problem using this. It saves energy/money and the sticky pads continue to stay firmly in place. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: lrluvsamazon

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: These locks are really useful and hold up well against toddlers. Super easy to set up, just peel, stick, and you're done. Easy to gain access by pinching the lock and pulling it off. To lock up again, pinch and place the lock back. Easy peasy. As a parent, I appreciate how easy this is to use. We were finally able to shut our bi-folding closet doors, which are located on our pantry and laundry doors- definitely wanted to keep our little one away from those areas. Very versatile as these can seemingly be placed anywhere to lock it away from toddlers. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strap not long enough for "Simple Human" Garbage Can
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our one year old who loves to keep opening the lid of the garbage can and pulling/throwing things inside... Unfortunately, the strap part isn't bendy or long enough to wrap around from the top of the lid to the body of the garbage can. The locks look like good quality, so we've kept them if we find another place our babe discovers, but we have to find something else for our garbage can...
customer_reviews.author: Mukul Shekhar

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised how well this works at keeping my one year old out of my fridge I wasn’t sure what to expect but this works great. It comes with two so I haven’t used the other one or tried it on different appliances but I’m very happy with how it’s keeping my fridge closed. My husband is a very big man and even if he forgets about the lock and tries opening the fridge, he’s unable to, so there’s a nice strong grip. Also, its very easy to open; I’ve seen my family and friends struggle with a lot of my baby safety gear. This is by far the easiest. I’m really really happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Used to fix our haunted drawer
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought this for a wonky drawer we had that would slide open on its own. It had the tracks to where you can't just take the drawer out, and we rent, so didn't really want to put too much work into taking the entire drawer out etc. This little baby was the perfecr solution! Easy to install, sticks well, and definitely tricky enough to keep a kid out of places they shouldn't be, yet not so difficult to use that an adult struggles. Our 6y/o can still get into the drawer, but it no longer slides open! Love that you don't have to use screws, so no damage to the cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Things Shut
customer_reviews.text: I got these to ensure that our Upright Freezer in the Garage stays shut. I had another brand's version that broke, and decided to try these ones. What I like is that both sides are on a pivot. So when we unhook one side, gravity pulls it down. This will help them last much longer, as before many times the strap/buckle would stay horizontal, and get shut in the freezer door. This is what caused them to weaken, and eventually break. This one gravity pulls down, and drops out of the way of the door when shutting.
customer_reviews.author: Gitterdone

customer_reviews.title: They work!!!
customer_reviews.text: You better make sure you put these in the right spot because you can’t move them. And by no means can the kids unlock them by there self. They lost two stars because they do not come with any extra adhesive’s. This is the only child safety item that I’ve ever purchased that did not come with extra adhesives and I’m having a hard time finding replacements for them. But they do stick so much so that I messed up my drawer when I needed to move it so I don’t know if that’s a good thing or a bad thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: If you want something that will stick to where you put it and NEVER come off then these are for you. One piece is now a permanent part of my kitchen counter. Unless it is a porous surface like the plastic lid of my trash can which was the purpose in purchasing these, then it won’t stick. The stickiness will then go away, leaving it a piece of trash. Basically these are a toss up, depending on where you are putting them. But for me it just isn’t a gamble I will make again. If you rent like I do then stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K.

customer_reviews.title: Functional door locks
customer_reviews.text: These are in no way a streamlined product, and they are quite bulky. But, they absolutely get the job done. My 18 month old just started pulling on the oven door handle and I wanted to stop it from opening before she got used to getting in there. I placed this on the door and they work great. The easy operate buttons are fine for adults, but baffling to a toddler. The whole piece rotates out of the way when in use/if no kids are around, so it's good for grandparents or caregivers who don't always have the kids around. Overall, I'm pretty happy.
customer_reviews.author: steel_muffinsTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I got this to keep my cats from opening the fridge when they are climbing around on it. I would rather the cats not climb on the fridge, but this will have to do. I have never come home to an open freezer since installing these latches. (And I know they've up there because they knock stuff down.) It is super easy to unlatch when I need in the fridge. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for cat proofing cupboards
customer_reviews.text: I have two very sneaky and very agile cats. They love to break into my corner cupboard, where my lazy susan is, and steal and destroy my coconut flour, shredds, cereals, etc. Then they like to drag the torn bags through the house so they leave a trail. The location of the cupboard is awkward as it's in between my sink and stove. I had to get creative and put this on the bottom of the cupboard, but it works! I haven't had to replace any dry goods since installing. And it's super easy to install and use, unlike some other childproofing products. Cat mom approved.
customer_reviews.author: Ezer

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: We have a very strong 1 year old son who is very curious and likes to get into cabinets we’d prefer him not to. I was hoping these would live up to the good reviews and be strong enough for our little brute. They have worked amazing! They stick to practically any surface, they do exactly what they are supposed to and to unlock them is super easy. They are stylish looking without being a total eye sore. We love this and would absolutely recommend these to other parents
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Family

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought these latches a couple of times. I don’t have kids. I use one to keep my freezer door sealed. They install easily and do a great job. And, they’re really easy to open. Over time they eventually stretch out a bit. Wouldn’t matter if I was using them to keep a cabinet closed because they don’t stretch much at all. But, with the freezer door, a small gap matters. So, once in a blue moon I buy a new set. I’m sure they’d work great for child-proofing as well.
customer_reviews.author: NinaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, but learn from my mistake!
customer_reviews.text: Over all these get the job done. But it is a little bulkier than I had hoped. Also the plastic between the 2 adhesive squares is pretty stiff so when I first applied it to my fridge, I thought I had it tight enough. But after a few uses, the plastic relaxed/softened a little and then it wasn't tight enough and it essentially wasted one of the lock's.
customer_reviews.author: Brad B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works as designed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to keep my cat from opening the cabinet door under my sink in my kitchen (he has an obsession). It worked like a charm. Very easy to install, just peel and stick. Adhesive has held well for the month that we've had it. Pretty straight forward device that works well for its intended purpose. I think the release mechanism would probably require more strength than a child could muster, but isn't inconvenient for an adult, and it's DEFINITELY strong enough to thwart my cat!
customer_reviews.author: hothotpot

customer_reviews.title: YAY! Toddler no longer!
customer_reviews.text: TODDLER BE GONE!!! THE TODDLER WILL NOT GET ANY MORE POTS, PANS, TUBBERWARE, SPATULAS... ANYTHING OUT OF THE CABINETS ANY LONGER! Seriously though, life saver. I was going nuts when my son would pull everything out of every cabinet and drawer (thankfully we also got a kiddy-gate that helps keep him out.) They're really easy to apply and use. *I have not however tried to move one once it's already been placed*
customer_reviews.author: cheryl stoyke

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These deserve more than five stars! We just moved and have a fridge with a front handle, so my toddler can now open the fridge and get whatever he pleases (along with putting things in the fridge that don’t belong there). Once putting this on, which was super easy, he no longer can get in. Woohoo! We also put one on our oven and that works great as well. We’ve had them on for about two weeks and they’re still as strong as they were day one. It’s also very easy to open and close. So far, so good! *Pic of my son’s favorite thing to put in the fridge before we put the safety lock on*
customer_reviews.author: Ashley W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: So this works great. It’s easy to install. It sticks on well. It dies what it’s supposed to. It’s easy to unlock as an adult so it’s not annoying for regular use. Two things to pay attention to when installing: 1) you might have to scuff high gloss paint for it to stick but with a little bit of sandpaper rubbing it sticks great. Obviously dust off paint powder. 2) when placing back adhesive make sure there is also clearance for the top and band.
customer_reviews.author: 👻

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever 😊
customer_reviews.text: So after reviewing many different latches& door protectors. I decided to go with this one because It’s a very reliable brand Munchkin. Secondly it looks durable and extremely easy to use no drilling no nails. I was a little concerned because of the peel and press however I am extremely pleased You just peel stick press & hold for a few min. Your done the latches are extremely easy to use. I’ve had it installed for a for a week now it’s grate . I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, for keeping toddlers out of things!!
customer_reviews.text: So perfect! I was so tired of seeing my two year old either in my pantry or the fridge every time I turned around. He’s a tall stinker and could open the fridge and pantry doors on his own- after finding the freezer open and my dog enjoying a frozen eggo waffle off the floor I decided I need to keep the toddler out of the freezer, fridge and pantry. These are so perfect!!! Easy enough for my 4 year old and 6 year old to still get their snacks on their own- but too tricky for the 2 year old!
customer_reviews.author: BBarker

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I was iffy about using these at first because I’ve tried the adhesive appliance locks before. They ALWAYS come unstuck after a week or so of use. But so far so good here! It’s easy to lock and unlock but not easy enough for my special needs 7 year old to get in to. We’ve been struggling to keep our 7 year old out of the fridge and freezer at night. She will gorge herself until she gets sick. She will eat an entire box of ice cream in one sitting. She has nothing telling her when she is full. So this is definitely helpful!!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Bagley

customer_reviews.title: Not for toilet seats!! Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: While this product says multi use and in the description it gives an example of toilet seats (which is why we bought this one) it failed us greatly. Wouldn’t even adhere to the toilet bowl part. We followed the directions step by step. Let it sit for a day even... and as soon as my 1 year had the opportunity to go check it out (with supervision) he simply lifted the bowl side latch right off. Waste of money unfortunately. Do not buy for toilet seat use.
customer_reviews.author: Donk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent adhesion, super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: These are hands-down the best baby proofing tools I've gotten. They work especially well with oven doors and freezer doors that are at the bottom of the fridge and pull out. I also have one on my stand up freezer. It's saved my life more times than I can count. I learned my lesson the hard way when I forgot to latch it one day and my son left the stand-up freezer open and everything thawed. Don't do what I did get these and save yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Gina A. Marandino

customer_reviews.title: Use it on my RV screen door
customer_reviews.text: I live in a fifth wheel RV. I put this on my screen door for a couple of reasons. First I hate when someone comes over ant they just walk in, even when the main door is closed it works like a safety chin. The second for when I don't get the screen door latch when I am leaving the main door open I use it to keep the cats from pushing the screen open. The main reason I got it was because of the cats but the safety chaining the door was just a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie McCormick

customer_reviews.title: At last!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these! My two year old was constantly getting in our fridge making horrible messes. I purchased other child proof locks from Walmart and they would never stick. Or if they did, after a few weeks he would end up breaking them. These little locks are awesome! They stick well. Are super easy to install and most importantly —they work!!!! He can’t figure them out and has pretty much given up on even trying. My life is so much better now bc of these.
customer_reviews.author: sdw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our oven
customer_reviews.text: Since our oven isn't connected to the stove top directly, the flame above, even when using the high speed turbo boiling option, it doesn't heat up the oven portion at all. We don't use the oven too often as we have an air fryer we use way more frequently. My daughter recently started opening things, so these looked like a good option for clamping the oven shut. so far so good. Good adhesion, and takes a semi strong grip to detach the locking mechanism so i have no fear that my 1-year old will be able to open the locks.
customer_reviews.author: Roger K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for French Doors
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought these months ago! The playroom in my house has pocket french doors and it was driving my nuts that my dogs figured out how to open the door and thus my toddler figured out how to open them and slam them and open them and slam them. I installed these latches, one on the outside and one on the inside, so I can keep the doors shut when needed. It's been a dream, no more toys meeting their doom because of the dog and no more toddler slamming doors all day.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Work so much better than the first brand we tried.
customer_reviews.text: These work great! We previously purchased a different brand to keep our toddler from getting into the silverware and my 2 year old was able to pull on the drawers hard enough that the other brand just popped right off. These work so well they kept Grandma out too until she realized there was a safety strap lol. They are easy to install and will open from either end making them very convenient. We have one on our oven too and so far the heat hasn't been an issue with the adhesive.
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect baby protection
customer_reviews.text: We bought this same pack several times, as we slowly watched our 1yr old child get into EVERYTHING... These latches are very durable, easy to install and seem to be working great on many different surfaces. We have a lazy-susan cabinet in the kitchen that we were very worried about our child getting stuck in -- alas, no longer! Munchkin's safety latches are now holding those closed and keeping our child OUT of trouble! Highly recommend these and have been using them for several months so far, so will see how they hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: jdubyou

customer_reviews.title: Awesome latches
customer_reviews.text: The fridge/freezer in the garage pops open if there is something slightly heavy in the door, i cant tell you how many times i have walked out there to grab something and saw the freezer door slightly ajar. Its a newer fridge so old seals are not the problem. I got these to make sure it doesnt happen again and since installing it has worked wonders! It was very easy to install. The latch is super easy also which is a major bonus
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Lock is hard for a kid to figure out.
customer_reviews.text: If you install these well with some thought (so easy to stick on), these work well. My son wants so badly to figure them out and he cannot. They work best for me on my trash can, actually, which is annoying to use but was necessary. Don’t install both ends on drawers — I had to do this because the middle section was kind of long, and my son can now pull both drawers out and kind of by-pass the lock. So, think before you stick!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for freezer door!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these in the past when I had toddlers. I didn't think that I needed them with school age children, but my little one kept opening the freezer which is well above his head. As the freezer is usually full, I fear something might fall out on him when he shakes it open. I put one of these on the side of the freezer door at the highest spot and it locks perfectly. Now he realizes that he can't open it and doesn't even try anymore. Crisis averted thanks to these flexible locks!
customer_reviews.author: Cactus

customer_reviews.title: Adhesive is not toddler proof ... smh
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of these locks but for parents, note it’s best to install when kids are sleeping. My one year old noticed after an hour or so , keeps attempting to pull the oven door open, until the adhesive lifts up . I tried to press it back down , it came up again . We shall see if the piece of adhesive that is holding on by a thread will be enough . I feel like I’m going to have to repurchase unfortunately. Also they are pretty large and chunky , not very appealing but guess when you have a toddler that goes out the window .
customer_reviews.author: Roderick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best child proofing tool!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as my son became mobile, he got into EVERYTHING. I have these handy child proofing contraptions on nearly every appliance: fridge, oven, dishwasher, washing machine, water dispenser, under oven drawer (used as a step stool to the stove) and bathroom cabinet. These have been a life (and sanity) saver!!! They are super simple to install (clean surface and stick) and are easy to operate with one hand. These have been very durable and versatile. Would definitely recommend these to all parents.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian M.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these yesterday and got them today. I was super excited to finally keep the kids from opening the fridge every 2 and a half minutes for no reason. Followed the install directions and put them both on the fridge. Adhesive would stick and they won’t stay locked. So needless to say they haven’t worked AT ALL! Definitely wouldn’t buy again and I really hate that I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: A must must must must
customer_reviews.text: We decided to look into locking things after finding MULTIPLE items in our trash can... thoughtfully thrown away by our trash can obsessed daughter. This works perfectly!! It require simultaneously pinching of two buttons to unlatch so it's hard for a toddler to figure out but quick enough for an adult to use. Setting it up was easy, you have to let it set for one hour, we will not be taking this off for a while so I can't speak to if it will damage anything.
customer_reviews.author: A. Le

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love these locks! They have worked great to keep our now two year old out of the fridge. We have been using the lock in our fridge for probably around 2 or 3 months now and it is real sturdy and not showing any signs of wear even with all the stress we give it...our two year old will tug and pull on the door often and we are constantly throughout the day locking and unlocking it and it is working as new! Could not be happier...may be installing another one on the dryer door as said two year old has been enjoying that door as well😊
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat proof
customer_reviews.text: I had to do something to keep my cat from opening the cabinets. He likes to sit there and pull the cabinet door open just a little and let it close. Bump. Bump. Bump. Bump. Bump. He occasionally would go inside and rattle the pots. This has put a stop to that. He now can’t get the doors open enough to make a satisfactory bump, so he quit. ON THE BOTTOM CABINETS!!!! He has learned to hop onto the counter and now does it to the top cabinets. Going to have to buy more now.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Spendy but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to help hold a mini fridge door closed that didn't quite seal properly. I really like how it blends nicely with the stainless steel. It sticks very well so far and is very sturdy and easy to operate. I especially liked the design of the ball and socket type lock because it would require breaking the plastic or ripping off the adhesive to come undone. Ones that are just a clip can easily pop off. These are a bit expensive for my preference but a great product if you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Kade

customer_reviews.title: These are great! My dog taught himself to open the fridge ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My dog taught himself to open the fridge door, so I went looking on Amazon for baby locks. A lot of them had bad reviews for the adhesive or for being cheap and breaking easily. I saw these recommended on a blog and I'm so glad I chose them. They are larger than expected and are sturdy and stick very well. I can't speak to how hard they'd be for a child to open... They're pretty easy for me, but that's exactly what I wanted, something to keep the dog out without making it annoying for me to use the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Child proof without being parent proof!
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well! So many baby proof tools are also parent proof but these locks are very easy to use. I was worried that they would be a hassle and therefore lead to the temptation to leave them open but I lock them every time. Easy to install, just make sure you can reach the clasp around your handle. Very strong adhesive—wouldn’t want to need to reattach so plan carefully!
customer_reviews.author: Reece Family

customer_reviews.title: Does not work, sadly 😩
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and everyone raved about how well it does. I stuck this on our fridge cause our kids like to eat (everything) lol Sadly, the adhesive did not stick to our stainless steel fridge. We tried one first and it didn't work. So we tried the other one and put weights on the adhesive over night to make it stick better but it still didn't work. We opened the door easily. I wish this worked 🔥
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get them to stick
customer_reviews.text: Although I know this is a great saftey product I wasn't happy about these and ended up buying other baby locks. I dont know if it was my fault or not, but for some reason I could not get these to stick to my wood cabinets. I don't blame this company simply because it may have just been the coating on my cabinets, but i dont see how when other locks I have on now stick just fine. You all will have to just be the judge on ther for yourself. May have just been my luck with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: I Shop A Lot

customer_reviews.title: Solid and works as expected
customer_reviews.text: After trying many of the auto lock versions, I went back to the reliable standard. Theses stuck well, and have held up to hard pulls from those forgetting they are on the door. Both buckles unlock, which is a nice feature. They are a little stiff, even after weeks of use, so I will remove one star. Kids 5-10 years old struggle with these a little, and these ages are a bit outside the targeted audience.
customer_reviews.author: C Gohman

customer_reviews.title: Strong and very well built
customer_reviews.text: These straps are awesome, I put them on my RV refrigerator to stop the doors from opening and so far they have exceeded my expectations. Adhesion is great and the sturdiness of the strap is outstanding. I am fairly certain that these would have no problems keeping small kids out as well. The push button releases very nice for older kids and adults. I have a tween and he has no problems popping them off.
customer_reviews.author: D. Long

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I got these to try to keep the fridge and cupboards shut. My 2.5 year old daughter has been getting into everything lately, especially with everything shut down right now. I got them with next day prime shipping and was very excited to use them. They did not stick very well at all. I was pretty let down about that. It wouldn't stick to my fridge door and it isn't really too textured or anything. It did stick to my cabinet that has cleaning supplies in it but I'm not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: T S

customer_reviews.title: Munchkin Xtraguard Dual Action Multi Use Latches
customer_reviews.text: Finally something that works! I tried several products which claimed to lock refrigerators and pantries against little intruders and they failed. Some had weak adhesion. Others were designed in such a way that it was difficult to snap the 2 parts together or required a 2-handed grip to open. This one has strong adhesion. It can be easily opened with one hand. Our 20-month-old was very disappointed he can no longer help himself.
customer_reviews.author: Y. G.

customer_reviews.title: One Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it a 5 star review because the one on the fridge has worked great, but the other one I put on some cabinet doors and one side has come off several times. I ended up having to use super glue to get it to stick. I'm sure it's just the difference in surfaces. I cleaned them before I applied tho, and the surface was flat and smooth so I feel like it should have stuck a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great way to baby proof!
customer_reviews.text: I got two packs of these with intentions for two. My 10 month old is quite persistent with our fridge and she finally got it open. Thankfully I had the other two laying around because it is the only thing saving my food right now! I only give it 4 star because I had put two on my entertainment center with sliding doors, and one of them popped off with no effort, so adhering it can possibly be an issue. Surfaces were cleaned before placing this product as well. Other than that, so glad I still have another one in case I need it because it rocks! Just make sure it’s fixed in place for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley zettel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and really durable!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as my little dude figured out how to open up the toilet, I bought these. I attached them immediately after they came and thank goodness. He walked right up to them, tried to yank them off, tried to open the toilet, then walked away! They’re super easy to use, really easy to attach, and they work well. They’re pretty self explanatory for people who are visiting and we haven’t had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Good... When it works.
customer_reviews.text: I got one set and one of them didn't stick. They were quick to replace and it works well when it does work... But warning that it might not!! Fortunately it's worth buying knowing Amazon is awesome and will replace things if they aren't working properly. Also a note: I am having trouble getting the adhesion off also of the one that only half stuck... I'm sure I'll figure it out. But it's seems like it could over all have a better design.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Strong. Work wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: We placed these on the dishwasher and the oven to keep our curious baby out. They have been working flawlessly. He's a pretty smart little guy, so there is no doubt in my mind he will figure out how to work them sooner rather than later, but they are keeping him out as of now. They have a strong hold also. He has pretty much hung off of the oven door and this held shut. I will be buying these again!
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: A bit more expensive for what they are but good quality
customer_reviews.text: My 3 1/2 year old cannot open them but neither can my toddler. Used for one toilet with barn door bathroom access. Only needed for this bath as the other doors are regular style and baby cannot open .this toilet we had to get a lock for as he can slide open this door and get into the toilet. Lock works well. Easy for our older kids to manipulate. One handed open. Easy and quick to latch back. So far so good! Would give five star but a bit over priced for sticky latch with plastic. But it is made well and serves its purpose
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CAT BURGLAR SAFETY 🔒!! 😿
customer_reviews.text: I am almost positive that I am the only person that purchased this to keep my cats out of the bread cabinet!! With that being said.... our bread is no longer strung throughout the house during the night, and we can rest peacefully knowing that our bread is on lockdown. I wish I could have seen the cats trying to figure out why the cabinet wouldn’t open....that would be priceless!! This product was super easy peasy to install and is well made and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer sapero

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but wish they had a longer strap
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my VERY busy little one that would sneak downstairs during the early morning and get into the fridge and pantry. They work great on our cabinets, however these didnt wrap around our fridge, so I had to stick it to the side of the door rather than the front which makes getting to it pretty hard even for me and I have small hands. My son doesnt have the pinching strength to open these though and he's 3 so I say this is a win!
customer_reviews.author: Jaryn

customer_reviews.text: These have been a life saver. I started with clips that never quite grabbed the door correctly when I would close he doors. These are sure to keep the doors closed. Our under the sink cleaning essentials are now always guarded keeping my baby safe. The only down side is if you don’t latch every time it is open to the littles getting in, but that is essentially my job; keeping the little one safe. Plus mine now will let me know if it isn’t latches and tries to help.
customer_reviews.author: Randah

customer_reviews.title: Wear out quickly and easily
customer_reviews.text: When we first got these they worked PERFECTLY. Very easy to install and our Houdini 2 year old could not open the fridge or freezer at all anymore. However, we’ve had these almost 2 months and they are already worn out and you have to jiggle the head with the snaps quite a bit to get it to latch. I gave 4 stars because they are so easy to install and they do work still. Just wish I could find some that are more durable!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R2

customer_reviews.title: Not oven safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to baby proof our oven. The outside of the package says, "secures refrigerators, microwaves, freezers, dishwashers, dryers, ovens and other appliances." I opened the package, read those instructions and it specifically states NOT to use on ovens. This is frustrating since I specifically bought it for the oven AND it specifically states on the outside of the package that this is a use for this product. I will keep them in case I find other baby proofing uses for them, but for now I need to buy another item for the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Toddlers can use, baby can’t
customer_reviews.text: My third kid made these a necessity at our house. I love that they were easy to put on, also it’s easy to just unlatch and leave open if I’m going to be opening the garbage can (what we use them for) a lot or if my kid is asleep. My toddler who is old enough to not throw random stuff away can open it when she needs to throw stuff away too so it works for older kids to still throw things away, and to keep baby out and stop her from throwing who knows what away!
customer_reviews.author: Susannah

customer_reviews.title: Not just to keep kids out...
customer_reviews.text: So the seal on our freezer was lifting and every time someone closed the fridge, the freezer would pop open- which caused everything to start thawing and the unit to run constantly. Cost to replace the gasket, $250 (including the service call and parts)... no thanks. We bought this handy little gadget instead and now the door doesn't pop open when someone opens the fridge. This worked so well we also installed one on the fridge in our camper (which also has a tendency to pop open while going down the road!).
customer_reviews.author: Budget101

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These clips work perfectly on any cabinet and are easy to apply. The adhesive is very strong and have been in place for months without any sign of slipping. The side buttons make it easy for an adult to unlock the strap, but it has just enough tension that would make it difficult for a child to open. The plastic straps are thick and sturdy and do not fall apart or break easily. I like the fact that both ends of the strap have clickable buttons/fasteners so you can use it to secure 2 doors that are side-by-side. I plan to purchase another set. I am very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: TSF

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Many many uses, but I recently had an issue with my old refrigerator Not sealing properly and after researching for a quick fix, discovered these latches and decided to give them a try and it worked perfectly im able to close the fridge now!
customer_reviews.author: Richie L

customer_reviews.title: hard for toddler to press.
customer_reviews.text: Using it to keep a freezer closed, but I think this will work great on drawers too. Seems to be sticking really tight, so I hope it will be long lasting, 2 nice features that is has are 1. you can open it from either end. and 2. when open you can swivel the closed end full circle so the lock can be moved totally out of the way when you don't need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Fill your home with these and frustrate your danger seeking toddler
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE these. Our toddler should become a locksmith when she is older because homegirl can get into anything. She figured out how to get the sliding door open and I put one of these on our of her reach and it gives me the extra bit of security knowing she isn’t getting out. PRO TIP: don’t be impatient. Let the adhesive sit for a bit before pulling on it.
customer_reviews.author: Weaks

customer_reviews.title: You need these!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these up for a few days but I think I'm in love! Stopped my destructive one year old in her tracks! I ordered more because my dear sweet child has found more stuff to get into since being stopped from getting into the kitchen and bathroom cupboards and drawers. They are a bit expensive and not the most visually appealing but I don't even care! I don't have to pick up evey item we own off the floor 5,000 times a day and the cost bought me sanity so I'm calling it a win!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: must have!
customer_reviews.text: love these! we've had on our fridge for a while now, definitely show younger kids how it works so they don't break it by twisting... we reattached with shipping tape and it's back in the game. I need to order more to put on interior doors I don't want slammed/closed during the day! and would love to have these on all my cabinets instead of screwing in hardware!
customer_reviews.author: C. McNeily

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to keep my clever pup out of the cupboard where we hide the trash bin. No babies here now buy I can tell it wouldn't be an easy clamp to open, as it takes a bit of hand coordination to push down on the buttons enough to unclip. Adhesive is strong, plastic is thick and it's holding up really well! Love that I can use this on ANY type door! Wish I had them when my babies were little!! Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Yani

customer_reviews.title: Easiest to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a young daughter with autism and use these on our doors to protect her from trying to get outside by herself. I have tried several different brands/kinds. I love that these are all contained in one piece (with other kinds, the lock piece is designed as a separate piece which is easy to lose). They are very user friendly and I was able to teach my older children how to use them without issue. I would 100% recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Quirke

customer_reviews.title: Used for our fridge
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with my fridge door that was "sprung". It kept causing condensations due to the problem... Anyhow it does help but just isn't strong enough to keep it tight close (it is better though). It is very strong though so I must give it its due. For any normal child proofing purpose it would work great. As a family we have forgot to unlatch it and yanked on the door multiple multiple times and it has never gave way due to our stupidity. So it VERY sticky for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, easy to use, secure
customer_reviews.text: Pros: sticks really strongly (make sure to clean the surface of any oils/ dirt, use alcohol) -clicks in very nicely and holds - secure but easily removed by an adult with pinching of the button -excellent quality and looks good - both sides can clip on and off - hmm idk but it keeps kids out Cons: if it only could lock and unlock by itself 😔.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ali

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 and 5 year old. We put it down low so my older son can still open the fridge. He has no problem opening and closing it. Keeps my little one safe because he was constantly trying to climb the drawers or sit inside. He’s definitely more “spirited” than his brother. I had to take off one star because the lowest quantity I could by was 2 which meant 4 locks and I only needed one.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

product_meta.title: Munchkin Xtraguard Dual Action Multi Use Latches, 2 Count
product_meta.description:
Secure cabinets, drawers, appliances, toilet seats and more with the Munchkin xtraguard dual action multi use latch. This handy 2 pack features a dual button operation to release, making it hard for children to open but easy for an adult. Simply release and rotate when not in use and push back to fasten. The flexible strap allows for latching around corners. Installation is quick and simple and the included adhesive removes easily without damaging surfaces.

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Secures cabinets, drawers, appliances, toilet seats, and more
Requires dual button operation to release, release and rotate when not in use
Flexible strap allows latching around corners
Easy to install with provided adhesive won't damage furniture and is easy to remove
Features a double layer of security providing tamper resilience and double locking protection

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars11,855 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
